experiment_info.name: reduced_nm_polish_4iter
experiment_info.description: Test if 4-6 NM iterations (instead of 8) maintain accuracy. Time saved could be used for more CMA-ES evaluations
experiment_info.hypothesis: Fewer NM polish iterations may be sufficient, freeing budget for more CMA-ES exploration

reason_aborted: Prior experiments have DEFINITIVELY answered this question. See reduced_fevals_more_polish and asymmetric_polish_budget.

reduced_fevals_more_polish.finding: Iterations 1-4: ~80% of improvement, Iterations 5-8: ~19% of improvement, Iterations 9-12: ~1% of improvement
reduced_fevals_more_polish.conclusion: Reducing from 8 to 4-6 would lose 19% of polish improvement

asymmetric_polish_budget.finding: Reducing 1-src polish from 8 to 4 hurts accuracy significantly without proportionate time savings
asymmetric_polish_budget.conclusion: 8 NM polish iterations is locally optimal

adaptive_nm_coefficients.finding: polish_tuning family is EXHAUSTED - NM x8 with defaults is optimal
adaptive_nm_coefficients.conclusion: No further polish iteration tuning can improve results
